output: The Titanic sank on April 15, 1912 due to a collision with an iceberg in the North Atlantic Ocean. The combination of a series of unfortunate events and the Titanic’s inadequate safety measures resulted in the sinking of the ship. More specifically, the iceberg ripped a massive gash across the starboard side of the hull and, due to the lack of lifeboats, over 1500 people perished.
